javadoc:
HashStore is a sorted, basic-block aware, store for Instruction "n-grams" to help quickly match similar
 sequences of Instructions between two functions.  The Instructions comprising a single n-gram are hashed
 for quick lookup by the main matching algorithm (HashedFunctionAddressCorrelation).  Hash diversity is
 important to minimize collisions, even though the number of hashes calculated for a single function pair
 match is small.
 
 Hashes are built and sorted respectively using the calcHashes() and insertHashes() methods. The main sort
 is on the number of collisions for a hash (indicating that there are duplicate or near duplicate instruction
 sequences), the hashes with fewer (or no) duplicates come first. The secondary sort is on
 "n", the number of Instructions in the n-gram, which effectively describes the significance of the match, or how
 unlikely the match is to occur at random.  The main matching algorithm effectively creates a HashSort for both
 functions, and then in a loop calls
    hash = getFirstEntry()    on one side to get the most significant possible match
    getEntry(has)             to see if there is a matching n-gram on the other side
    
 If there is a match it is declared to the sort with the matchHash() call, allowing overlapping n-grams to be
 removed and deconflicting information to be updated.  If there is no match, hashes can be removed with the
 removeHash() method to allow new hashes to move to the top of the sort.
 
 The store uses a couple of methods to help deconflict very similar sequences of instructions within the same function.
 Primarily, the sort is basic-block aware.  All n-grams are contained within a single basic block, and when an initial
 match is found, hashes for other n-grams within that block (and its matching block on the other side) are modified
 so that n-grams within that block pair can only match each other.

methods.javadoc: @return total number of Instructions in the whole function
methods.name: getTotalInstructions

return.comment: total number of Instructions in the whole function

methods.javadoc: @return number of instructions that have been matched so far
methods.name: numMatchedInstructions

return.comment: number of instructions that have been matched so far

methods.javadoc:
Set up the basic-block and instruction model and the accompanying hash containers
@throws CancelledException
methods.name: initializeStructures
methods.comment: Set up the basic-block and instruction model and the accompanying hash containers

methods.javadoc:
Create the basic Block structure, walk the Instructions creating InstructHash structures
@param codeBlock is the set of instruction addresses corresponding to the basic block
methods.name: createBlock
methods.comment: Create the basic Block structure, walk the Instructions creating InstructHash structures

params.name: codeBlock
params.comment: is the set of instruction addresses corresponding to the basic block

methods.name: insertNGram
methods.comment: Low level insert of an n-gram into the HashStore

params.name: curHash
params.comment: is hash of the n-gram

params.name: instHash
params.comment: is (starting Instruction of) the n-gram

methods.javadoc:
Insert all n-gram hashes for a particular instruction
@param instHash is the instruction
methods.name: insertInstructionNGrams
methods.comment: Insert all n-gram hashes for a particular instruction

params.name: instHash
params.comment: is the instruction

methods.name: removeNGram
methods.comment: Low level removal of a particular n-gram from the sort

params.name: instHash
params.comment: is (starting instruction) of the n-gram

params.name: curHash
params.comment: is hash (and size) of the n-gram

methods.javadoc:
Remove all n-grams associated with a particular instruction
@param instHash is the particular instruction
methods.name: removeInstructionNGrams
methods.comment: Remove all n-grams associated with a particular instruction

params.name: instHash
params.comment: is the particular instruction

methods.javadoc:
Remove a particular HashEntry.  This may affect multiple instructions.
@param hashEntry is the entry
methods.name: removeHash
methods.comment: Remove a particular HashEntry.  This may affect multiple instructions.

params.name: hashEntry
params.comment: is the entry

methods.name: calcHashes

params.name: minLength
params.comment: is the minimum length of an n-gram for these passes

params.name: maxLength
params.comment: is the maximum length of an n-gram for these passes

params.name: wholeBlock
params.comment: if true, allows blocks that are smaller than the minimum length to be considered as 1 n-gram.

params.name: hashCalc
params.comment: is the hash function

methods.javadoc: Insert all hashes associated with unknown (i.e not matched) blocks and instructions
methods.name: insertHashes
methods.comment: Insert all hashes associated with unknown (i.e not matched) blocks and instructions

methods.name: matchHash
methods.comment:
Mark a particular n-gram hash and instruction as having a match.
 Set of instructions covered by n-gram are removed, and data structures are updated

params.name: match
params.comment: is the n-gram being declared as a match

params.name: instResult
params.comment: collects the explicit set of Instructions matched

params.name: blockResult
params.comment: collects the explicit set of CodeBlocks matched

methods.name: extendMatch
methods.comment:
Try to extend a match on a pair of n-grams to the Instructions right before and right after the n-gram.
 The match is extended if the Instruction adjacent to the n-gram, and its corresponding pair on the other side,
 hash to the same value using the hash function. The NgramMatch objects are updated to reflect the
 original n-gram match plus any additional extension.

params.name: nGramSize
params.comment: is the original size of the matching n-gram.

params.name: srcInstruct
params.comment: is the first Instruction in the "source" n-gram

params.name: srcMatch
params.comment: is the "source" NgramMatch object to be populate

params.name: destInstruct
params.comment: is the first Instruction in the "destination" n-gram

params.name: destMatch
params.comment: is the "destination" NgramMatch object to populate

params.name: hashCalc
params.comment: is the hash function object

methods.javadoc: @return list of unmatched instructions across the whole function
methods.name: getUnmatchedInstructions

return.comment: list of unmatched instructions across the whole function

methods.javadoc: Clear the main sort structures, but preserve blocks and instructions
methods.name: clearSort
methods.comment: Clear the main sort structures, but preserve blocks and instructions

methods.javadoc: @return true if there are no n-grams left in the sort
methods.name: isEmpty

return.comment: true if there are no n-grams left in the sort

methods.javadoc: @return the first HashEntry in the sort.  The least number of matching n-grams and the biggest n-gram.
methods.name: getFirstEntry

return.comment: the first HashEntry in the sort.  The least number of matching n-grams and the biggest n-gram.

methods.name: getEntry
methods.comment: Get the HashEntry corresponding to a given hash

params.name: hash
params.comment: is the Hash to match

return.comment: the set of n-grams (HashEntry) matching this hash

methods.name: getBlock
methods.comment: Get the basic-block with the corresponding start Address

params.name: addr
params.comment: is the starting address

methods.javadoc: @return the TaskMonitor for this store
methods.name: getMonitor

name: HashStore
comment:
HashStore is a sorted, basic-block aware, store for Instruction "n-grams" to help quickly match similar
